Posts.Content: Hi, I have been called back to hospital this Thursday for further screening (a tomosynthesis, ultrasound and possible biopsy) following a routine annual mammogram that has shown a 13mm area of density that was not on my mammogram last year. My mum died of BC aged 49, my sister died of BC aged 50. I am a 46, single mum of two beautiful children and scared witless. Since my call back I can feel pain in my breasts which I assume is mainly in my head. All sorts of thoughts going through my head. Any advice to keep positive please. Thanks Xx
Posts.Title: Waiting and terrified

Posts.Content: Hi mistymoley  Thank you for your kind message. I can't remember all the details of my mum's and sister's type of cancer. They were both very aggressive but not proved to be linked. My sister did have genetic testing and it was negative for the BRCA gene, but the consultant thinks there is probably a genetic link but one that hasn't been discovered yet. Only one more sleep before my followup tests so that's good. It has made me realise that even if, God willing, the results are good tomorrow that I need to start the process or preventative surgery. Thanks again for the stats and the support. Xxx

Posts.Content: Hi Toxophilite Thank you for you lovely message and the hug.  Yes, I have annual reviews due to family history and my risk score. My children are 11 and 9, they are my world.  I am keeping busy at work but going picnicking with the children on Friday. Xxx
